# The `IRPosition` Struct Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

<MembersIndex>

  type="int"
  name={<><a href="#a593d823cf50de540a86b8c87a391d932">NumEncodingBits</a> =

</MembersIndexItem>

</MembersIndex>

## Description {#details}

Helper to describe and deal with positions in the LLVM-IR.

A position in the IR is described by an anchor value and an &quot;offset&quot; that could be the argument number, for call sites and arguments, or an indicator of the &quot;position kind&quot;. The kinds, specified in the <a href="#a53f576f97e0dfa8314afb16bd74a76d0">Kind</a> enum below, include the locations in the attribute list, i.a., function scope and return value, as well as a distinction between call sites and functions. Finally, there are floating values that do not have a corresponding attribute list position.

Definition at line 586 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/ipo/attributor-h">Attributor.h</a>.

### anonymous enum  {#aa8ead3291dbfc9e4fd79c301675bea2d}

The encoding of the <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irposition">IRPosition</a> is a combination of a pointer and two encoding bits.

  labels = {["inline"]}>
Return the value this abstract attribute is anchored with.

The anchor value might not be the associated value if the latter is not sufficient to determine where arguments will be manifested. This is, so far, only the case for call site arguments as the value is not sufficient to pinpoint them. Instead, we can use the call site as an anchor.
